title: The Gift of Service
sub_title: Serving with a Heart of Humility
devotional:
The annual Christmas toy drive at the community center was usually a highlight for Sarah. Each year, she volunteered, sorting through the donations, wrapping presents, and feeling the joy of bringing smiles to children's faces. This year, however, Sarah found herself wrestling with a different emotion: resentment. Her own financial situation had taken a turn for the worse, and she struggled to make ends meet. Seeing the abundance of toys, knowing that she couldn't afford to buy her own children the gifts they desired, filled her with a bitterness she hadn't anticipated.

As she sorted through a pile of plush animals, she overheard two other volunteers discussing their own holiday plans, boasting about extravagant vacations and lavish gifts. Sarah felt a pang of envy and a wave of self-pity. She almost walked out, wanting to escape the reminder of her own inadequacy.

But then, a small, worn teddy bear caught her eye. It was missing an eye and had several patches, but it was clean and clearly well-loved. Attached to it was a note that read, "This was my favorite bear when I was little. I hope it brings joy to another child this Christmas." Something about the simplicity and sincerity of the note touched Sarah deeply. It reminded her that true service wasn't about grand gestures or material wealth, but about offering what you have, no matter how small, with a heart full of love.

Sarah realized that her resentment was blinding her to the true meaning of service. It wasn't about comparing herself to others or feeling sorry for her own circumstances, but about focusing on the needs of those around her and finding joy in giving, even when she felt she had little to offer. She refocused her energy, determined to make the toy drive a success, not for accolades or recognition, but out of genuine compassion for the children in her community. The worn teddy bear became a symbol for her, a reminder that the greatest gifts are often the simplest and that the most meaningful service comes from the heart.
image_description: A close-up shot of a worn, but clean teddy bear with a handwritten note tied to its paw, sitting among other donated toys.
insights: Sarah's experience illustrates the potential for even acts of service to become tainted by selfish motives or negative emotions. The Bible warns against this, emphasizing the importance of serving with humility and a pure heart. 1 Peter 4:10-11 states, 'Each of you should use whatever gift you have received to serve others, as faithful stewards of God’s grace in its various forms. If anyone speaks, they should do so as one who speaks the very words of God. If anyone serves, they should do so with the strength God provides, so that in all things God may be praised through Jesus Christ.'
prayer: Dear Lord, forgive me for the times when my service has been motivated by selfish desires or tainted by negative emotions. Help me to cultivate a heart of humility and compassion, so that I may serve others with genuine love and joy. Remind me that true service is not about what I have to offer, but about what I am willing to give from the heart. Fill me with your grace, so that I may be a faithful steward of your gifts. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: In what areas of your life do you find it difficult to serve others with a pure heart? What steps can you take to overcome these challenges and cultivate a more selfless attitude? How can you find joy in serving, even when you are facing your own struggles?
